title: George Clooney reveals he and Amal will no longer be travelling to certain countries to "avoid the danger"
text:
George Clooney reveals he and Amal will no longer be travelling to certain countries to "avoid the danger" The Hollywood actor and lawyer say they will be more responsible now they're going to be parents   Share   Comments By Zoe Shenton 02:45, 22 FEB 2017 Celebs George: We will be more responsible now     celebs   George Clooney has revealed he and wife Amal Clooney will no longer be travelling to certain countries. 
The Hollywood star said they have decided to be much more responsible after finding out they are expecting twins.
The couple used to enjoy the "pretty exciting side" of going somewhere no reporter had ever been before but are avoiding this risky travel now Amal is pregnant.
He said: "We decided to be much more responsible, to avoid the danger. I will not go to South Sudan anymore and in the Congo, Amal will no longer go to Iraq and she will avoid places where she knows she is not welcome.
George Clooney and Amal Clooney (Photo: Getty Images North America) "Before, I did not care, I would even say that there was a pretty exciting side to going where no reporter had ever been. We have the chance to live between three countries: Italy, America and England."
And the couple will choose somewhere to settle once their twins reach school age but will move around with their schedules in the meantime.
He told Paris Match magazine: "[When they go to school, we'll] choose where to settle. In the meantime, we will continue to move according to our respective schedules. People think we're never together, but we have not been separated for more than a week." 
The pair looked happy and relaxed as they posed for pictures (Photo: Getty) Read More George Clooney looking forward to the "adventure" of parenthood as he speaks about expecting twins with wife Amal Meanwhile, George previously opened up about how he thinks parenthood will "be an adventure".
He said: "We are really happy and really excited. It's going to be an adventure. We've sort of embraced it all with arms wide open."
And the Monument's Men star's friends were "very supportive" when they found out the news, despite giving him a hard time at first.
George and Amal Clooney on the red carpet for the screening of the film "Money Monster" at the 69th Cannes Film Festival in Cannes (Photo: VALERY HACHE/AFP/Getty Images) Actor George Clooney and his wife Amal Clooney attend the "Money Monster" premiere during the 69th annual Cannes Film Festival (Photo: Getty) Read More George Clooney's mum confirms actor's pregnant wife Amal is expecting twin boy and girl He shared: "My favourite part is, you know, all my friends who are my age, and I have many of them, they're already done. Their kids are all grown up and away to college and they are laughing.
"We went out to dinner the other night, and it's a table of eight guys and all their kids are away in college, and we are sitting there and they were all being very supportive, 'Everything is going to be great, you're going to love it.' Then it got really quiet, and they all just started making baby crying and the whole table just busted up laughing."
